image.altText: Toutai Kefu arrives at the Supreme Court of Queensland in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The teens — who cannot legally be identified — were originally charged with the attempted murder of Mr Kefu, his wife Rachel Kefu and their two adult children in August 2021.

title.children: 'Just stab them': Teens who attacked rugby great Toutai Kefu and his family in their home sentenced

image.altText: A man in a suit talking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Energy Minister Mick de Brenni claims he was misinformed by management at CS Energy, prompting him to deliver wrong information to parliament the day after a power station explosion in May 2021.

title.children: Queensland energy minister claims he was given 'incorrect' advice after power plant explosion

image.altText: A woman runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: NSW will try to wrest the shield from Maroons' hands in enemy territory, as the first-ever three-game Women's Origin series goes to a decider in Townsville. Follow live.

title.children: Another sellout in Townsville for first Women's State of Origin decider

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Final teams: NSW stands pat as Queensland welcomes back impact prop

image.altText: Scam victim Lee Braz on motorbike.

props.synopsis: Lee fought the financial ombudsman all the way to the federal court when scammers stole his super. Despite winning he only got some money back and after legal fees he's worse off.

title.children: 'Worked 40 years for nothing': Scammers tricked Lee's super fund and stole 180k

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders Bruce Lehrmann to pay $2 million to Network Ten over his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann ordered to pay $2 million to Network Ten over failed defamation case

image.altText: An advertisment for gummy mushrooms

props.synopsis: An urgent recall is issued for Uncle Frog mushroom gummies after consumers around the country are hospitalised with serious health symptoms including hallucinations and seizures.

title.children: 'I'm quite traumatised by the whole thing': Mushroom gummies recalled after more than eight people hospitalised

image.altText: The six politicians stand in front of the US Capitol building.

props.synopsis: A cross-party delegation of jet-lagged and obstinate Australian parliamentarians arrived in Washington DC last September to advocate for Julian Assange's freedom. Those in the room reflect on how the "robust", and at times "aggressive", meeting went.

title.children: 'There was an attempt to brush us away': How six Australian MPs took the cause of Julian Assange to Washington

image.altText: Police on suburban street with blue and white tape cordoning off the area.

props.synopsis: Officers were called to a home in Russell Lea just after 11am when member of the public reported hearing a woman scream for help.

title.children: Sydney woman found dead in sharehouse suffered 'significant and multiple' stab injuries

image.altText: a man sitting on a footpath

props.synopsis: Matt feels ashamed when he sees the recent increase in domestic violence-related stories. He recognises he was forming his own dangerous coercive control traits before he voluntarily sought help from a men's behaviour change program.

title.children: When Matt's relationships all failed, he recognised the 'common denominator was me' and he needed change

image.altText: A man in glasses wearing a tie.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has been put on the spot about inflation as the Coalition upped the ante on its cost of living attacks.

title.children: PM under pressure over inflation as Question Time heats up — as it happened

image.altText: Albanese at the lectern has both hands in the air, waving to the room, as photographers take pictures

props.synopsis: The electoral cycle rollercoaster has Labor holding on for dear life, with the federal party going through its lowest of ebbs this term.

title.children: As voters look forward to cost-of-living relief coming next week, they're not the only ones getting a pay rise

image.altText: a pair of hands in handcuffs held by someone behind their back

props.synopsis: More than a third of victims were aged between 10-17 years old when the incident occurred, according to new data released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Australia has reached its highest number of sexual assault victims in more than three decades, says ABS

image.altText: A high shot of a crowd of people, many holding phones to photograph a woman walking through them.

props.synopsis: The normally quiet East Hotel lobby in Kingston resembled something closer to a mosh pit on Wednesday night, as more and more of Julian Assange's supporters and miscellaneous sticky-beakers crammed in.

title.children: A Canberra crowd had gathered to watch Origin — but the Assange family's arrival next door was soon turning heads

image.altText: Man with glasses

props.synopsis: Teacher and former NRL player Keith Eshman has told a court he did not sexually assault a young girl on multiple occasions.

title.children: School teacher asked about Google search history after denying child abuse

image.altText: An AI-generated image of a robot wearing headphones and playing a keyboard in a music studio, with speakers behind it

props.synopsis: The use of artificial intelligence is on the rise but some of the biggest record companies in the world believe AI is marching to the beat of its own drum.

title.children: Here are five quick facts about why US record companies are suing AI song-generators

image.altText: wind farm hero option b

props.synopsis: Developers say the proposed 100 turbine farm to be built near Collie, outside the town of Moodiarrup, will produce enough electricity to power the Perth CBD.

title.children: Hundred-turbine wind farm to be built 55km from proposed Coalition nuclear power plant site

image.altText: a galaxy above a dark strip of land over the sea

props.synopsis: Just 30 kilometres north of a bustling CBD but surrounded by national parks, Palm Beach headland has been given the nod by the DarkSky International organisation.

title.children: The Sydney stargazing spot globally recognised for its dark night skies

image.altText: ben in front of pub edited (1)

props.synopsis: If it happened in the middle of a city "there'd be a national disaster declared" says an outback mayor dealing with constant phone and internet outages.

title.children: Publican Ben is fed up with his telco. Like many Australians, he's making a switch

image.altText: Two power transmission towers in the middle on an open field with a sunrise in the background.

props.synopsis: The Central West Orana Renewable Energy Zone becomes the first in Australia to secure planning approval for the transmission lines that will link renewable projects to the electricity grid. Some residents say their concerns have been "overlooked".

title.children: Renewable Energy Zone transmission lines given green light, despite lingering community concerns

image.altText: a young man in a white robe leads a procession of priests through a Catholic church

props.synopsis: A Melbourne church is defying the Pope with a centuries-old service in a dead language. Why are so many young Catholics travelling hours to get there?

title.children: 'Zoomers want authenticity': These young Catholics are choosing a dead language over a modernising Pope

image.altText: An AI-generated image of a robot wearing headphones and playing a keyboard in a music studio, with speakers behind it

props.synopsis: The use of artificial intelligence is on the rise but some of the biggest record companies in the world believe AI is marching to the beat of its own drum.

title.children: Here are five quick facts about why US record companies are suing AI song-generators

image.altText: A middle-aged white man with white hair in a suit walks out of court surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: While we have no idea how Julian Assange is coping from being cooped up inside for so long with few visitors, we do know that isolation can have a severe negative impact on many people.

title.children: Julian Assange was isolated for more than a decade. Here's what that does to the body and mind

image.altText: A close up of an older woman wearing a black chef's hat and apron reading 'Nonna's Cucina'

props.synopsis: The court heard Francesco Dimasi, 92, was bed-ridden and suffering dementia and would not be entering a plea to one count of murder "at all, based on mental fitness".

title.children: Accused wife-killer allegedly inflicted '76 sharp force injuries' when he stabbed her to death, court hears

image.altText: A sign hangs on a bridge that saying "never never open bridge"

props.synopsis: Residents of an estate in Upper Kedron have been waiting six months for a finished bridge to open — and they're running out of patience.

title.children: The 'never never open bridge' was completed six months ago — but residents still can't cross it

image.altText: A tiny baby sleeping on someone's chest

props.synopsis: When Jenny Summerson answered a newspaper ad in the 1990s for a hospital helper, she had no idea she'd become an expert cuddler in the maternity ward.

title.children: What it takes to be a 'cuddle carer': Advice from a veteran of 1,000 hugs

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: AI-generated videos of Elon Musk asking people to invest in cryptocurrency were uploaded to the Channel Seven YouTube channel after it appeared to be hacked.

title.children: Channel Seven investigating after YouTube page replaced with AI-generated Elon Musk videos

image.altText: A group of players celebrate an Origin try

props.synopsis: Only two New South Wales sides have won deciders on Queensland soil but after their thumping win in Melbourne, this year's Blues are certain they can climb Origin's highest mountain.

title.children: 'What a story it's going to be': Why Blues believe they can pull off State of Origin's mission impossible

image.altText: Michael Sukkar wears a suit with a red tie.

props.synopsis: Shadow Minister for Housing Michael Sukkar says the number overseas arrivals since Labor came to power is four times greater than the number of houses built. RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Fact check: Are overseas arrivals outpacing housing construction at a rate of four to one?

image.altText: A mugshot of a man in a composite image with a court house.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy who performed first aid on his mum and CPR on her new boyfriend, who had both been stabbed by the boy's father, has been praised by a judge for "undoubtedly" saving his mother's life.

title.children: 'Family violence of the most extreme kind': Man sentenced for stabbing ex-partner, new boyfriend in front of children

image.altText: A man with a black shirt and gold chains sits in a car

props.synopsis: WA Police allege a 42-year-old Perth man organised people to kill his father-in-law in India, in a violent attack which left the man with serious brain injuries.

title.children: Perth man allegedly hired hit men in India in attempt to kill father-in-law

image.altText: Daniel Victor Gandini, wearing a three piece suit and peak cap, standing in the sunshine on the street in Burnie.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man found guilty of two counts of assault and of splashing a corrosive acid on arresting police officers in 2021 has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: 'Diplomat Dan' sentenced to more than three years' jail over assault of wife, splashing acid on police

image.altText: A large portrait of the artist painted on the side of an appartment building. It pictures the artist gazing out at the viewer

props.synopsis: It was one of Australian artist Jasmine Crisp's "biggest ever life dreams" to paint an original international mural — and she had only one week to do it.

title.children: A trolley of paint and 12-hour days: Aussie artist pulls off three-storey mural in Italy in a week
